title: Jar with Impressed and Incised Decoration
dimensions: 3 3/8 x greatest diam. 1 15/16 in. (8.5 x 5 cm)
section: The Predynastic Period and the Early Dynastic Period

museum_location.name: This item is not on view

completeness.name: Good
completeness.description: Most data is approved, but records have not been fully vetted. Many objects have quality photos and descriptions.

labels.title: 09.889.446
labels.content: The rows of triangles on this jar, alternately decorated and plain, typify early Nubian pottery design. Examples of Egyptian pottery from the same period, decorated mostly with painted scenes of humans and animals, can be seen in the nearby Early Egypt gallery.

collections.name: Egyptian, Classical, Ancient Near Eastern Art
